Programs
Thanks to an incredible network of open source online communities it has been possible to create this platform without much costs. Special thanks to:

Javascript, Vue, Quasar, Visual Studio Code, Github, Stackoverflow, Leaflet.

Guidelines.section1:
We are very pleased by everyone who is adding and editing information. It helps the community to be informed with the latest information. Our goal is to inform as many users in the best possible way, and therefore we created a few guidelines that needs to be respected. The guidelines are pretty straight forward, and they are not difficult to understand. We just ask everyone who contributes to use hers or his common sense. With that expertise, everything should be fine.

1. Content should only be about bicycle touring related subjects
Yes, that's right, this is a bicycle touring platform, and we want to inform people about bicycle touring, and bicycle touring ONLY. There is no room for other travel types. Therefore, you should try to find another platform.

2. Write in English
The most common travel language is English, and we ask everyone to write in English. This counts for all the information that is contributed on the country pages. On your own profile, you are free to write in which language you want. In the near future we might implement a translation system, which will make it possible to write in any language you want.

3. Respect other users
We're all different, and we like to keep it that way. This platform is meant to talk about bicycle touring related subject. Any form of discrimination will be rejected. Instead, be kind to each other and enjoy life ;)

4. Correct information
Information that is contributed needs to be correct. Of course, everyone can make a mistake, but keep in mind that your information can be seen as the only source of information available, and therefore we ask you to be accurate in what you write. In the worst case, wrong information can lead to dangerous situations.

5. Spam and advertisement
Generating attention for personal gain is seen as spam, and will not be tolerated. Don't use your name or share links at places where it doesn't add value. Instead, try to add valuable places like border crossings, places to obtain a visa, or see and do items. The better they are, the more traffic you might generate to your own profile. On your profile page, you are able to be as creative as possible with the content you want to share. Just keep in mind that most people don't appreciate spam at all, so try to hold your horses.

Conclusion
We ask everyone to keep the above guidelines in mind. If you happen to violate these guidelines, or behave indifferent in any other way, your content will be edited or deleted. We will warn you if you do so. As mentioned before, mistakes can be made, so we hope that you will learn from it. On the other hand, we will see it as a sign to improve the functionality of the community. However, if we notice that you violate the guidelines on purpose, we will consider to delete your account permanently.

May the winds be with you!

The Cycle Planet Team

Houserules.section1:
What you can expect from us:
  • Cycle Planet is and will always be a free to use platform, donations are welcome to improve our services.
  • We will try our best to keep this platform clean from advertisements and spam.
  • Privacy and data protection are most valuable to us.
What we expect from you:
  • Never ask money for hosting other users. The hosting part is based on give and take. If you get hosted during a trip, it would be welcome if you give back to the community by hosting people yourself after your trip.
  • Make sure to read our guidelines when you add or edit information.
  • Don't abuse the freedom you have to add and edit information.
  • Don't spam, sell or advertise on this platform.
  • Don't support racism, hate speeches, violence and more of these unwelcome aspects.
  • Respect local laws and don't violate them.
  • Don't share information on how to violate local laws, such as wildcamping when it's forbidden, or how to bribe officials.
Conclusion
We ask everyone to keep the above houserules in mind. If you happen to violate these houserules, or behave indifferent in any other way, your account can be deleted. We will warn you if you do so. As mentioned before, mistakes can be made, so we hope that you will learn from it. However, if we notice that you violate the houserules on purpose, we will consider to delete your account permanently.

May the winds be with you!

The Cycle Planet Team

Learn more.section1:
Welcome to Cycle Planet!

Learn all you need to know about our platform, the Swiss army knife of the bicycle touring world. There is an interactive map with all sorts of interesting points (visas, border crossings, activities, other cyclers, and much more), detailed information about each of these places, a database of countries with even more information such as general info, safety, inspirational blogs and videos and more. 

This platform can even be used to find hosts for your next destinaion, for free!

Map
There is an interactive map of the world, with markers of users and points of interests. Users either are available for hosting (red marker), not available for hosting (grey marker), or touring (yellow marker). 

There is a list of points of interests markers, such as wildcamping, formal camping, campsite, ho(s)tels, bike shops, see and do, visas, border crossings, shop, water points, ATM's, warnings and other. Each registered user can add new markers to the map, edit existing ones, or comment and share their latest experience.

    

   


Country information
In total there is a database of 213 countries available on this platform, each containing it's own unique information regarding bicycle touring. The list of countries can be found in the countries tab (with the earth icon). 

You can like a country by pressing the heart button, causing it to appear in your favorites list so you can access it quickly. By pressing one of the country buttons, you'll land on the country page. As of 2021, you may notice a lot of empty pages, as we launched only recently. However, every registered user can add or edit information by pressing the pen button or the plus button. 

Check out the page of Honduras, which is filled in almost completely by our volunteer Tulio. Just like him, you can become a contact person for a country, apply now on our team page.

      

Hosting
This platform can even be used to find hosts for your next destinaion, for free! In the map you can see all users who are available for hosting, having a red marker. You can click on their marker to be redirected to their profile. 

From here, you can send them a message. You can either send a normal message, or send an official host request (press the 3 dots in the top-right corner). By sending an official host request, the other user will get an email, and we can also track how much hosts request someone accepts or declines, causing the platform to work even better.



Profile
Every user has a profile, in which personal information can be shared. It's the place to share your own social channels, and let others know which awesome trips you've made so far. 



More
And there is more. For people who just discovered the awesome world of bicycle touring, there is an inspiration page with some of the greatest bicycle trips we've seen (take Ed Pratt for example, who cycled around the world on a unicycle!).

There is also a page with usefull apps and groups, like WhatsApp groups in which you can ask fellow travelers very detailed questions about a specific region.

Last but not least, there is a gear page, having some of the best equipment that can be used on bicycle touring. This page currently doesn't had the attention that it need, but we'll add more stuff in the near future.

   


Follow us
Of course we are also active on Instagram and Facebook, where we share some of the most epic pictures from people cycling around the world. To become featured, use @cycle.planet or #cycleplanet and who knows we share your story next!

Our story.section1:
We all know that bike touring is the coolest hobby in the world. The founder Bas came in touch with bike touring during his backpack trip in Central Asia, where one of the most popular routes among bike toureres appeared to be. A world of opportunities opened for him, as a bike can take you gain an incredible amount of freedom. Bas was sold, and started his own world trip a few years later, in 2019. The original idea was to go from The Netherlands, towards Cape Town via West Africa, go to Asia via East Africa, then Oceania, sail the Great Ocean and then cycle South and North America. All of this came to an abrubt end after having cycled 20.000 km in one year and through some of the thougest countires in the world. Just a few days removed from the South African border, Bas had to fly home from Namibia, after the corona epidemic took control of the world. 

During Bas his trip, finding information about visas, border crossings, embassies and other subjects was possible with places like Facebook groups, Whatsapp groups and iOverlander, but could definelty be better and more bike touring specific. The ultimate source of information could be a bike touring platform, in which users can add and edit information based on their own experiences. Small ideas started to grow into something larger, like the possibilities to let users find each other and interact with each other. 

Starting with little knowledge about coding, Bas started to learn making an android app. In September 2020 the first version of the android app was lauched, but soon realised that only an android app wouldn't be sufficient, and a website and iOs app should be released as well. Starting again with little knowledge about coding a website, Bas found out that a single sourcecode could be made to create a platform on all 3 major user devices.

Having launched the first version of the website and the apps for both Android and iOs in January 2021, a major step has been made.

And even after the launch, new and promising ideas are still coming up (like recording your trip, translate system, adding routes, a social feed system and more). To be continued!

Privacy policy.section1:
Last updated 18-12-2020

General note from founder Bas Idsinga: As comlicated as these privacy policies may be, I have not a single intention to abbuse the data that is collected through Cycle Planet. I also have to admit that I don't know too much about privacy regulations and that I just Googled the form below. I would like to warn you that the information might be incorrect or outdated, and I would like to confince you that it is my top priority to protect your personal information from falling into the hands of people who hate cycling.

Cycle Planet built the Cycle Planet app as a Free app. This SERVICE is provided by Cycle Planet at no cost and is intended for use as is.

This page is used to inform visitors regarding our policies with the collection, use, and disclosure of Personal Information if anyone decided to use our Service.

If you choose to use our Service, then you agree to the collection and use of information in relation to this policy. The Personal Information that we collect is used for providing and improving the Service. We will not use or share your information with anyone except as described in this Privacy Policy.

The terms used in this Privacy Policy have the same meanings as in our Terms and Conditions, which is accessible at Cycle Planet unless otherwise defined in this Privacy Policy.

Information Collection and Use

For a better experience, while using our Service, we may require you to provide us with certain personally identifiable information, including but not limited to name, email, about, interests, countries cycled, gear, website, instagram account, facebook account, youtube account. The information that we request will be retained by us and used as described in this privacy policy. The app does use third party services that may collect information used to identify you. Link to privacy policy of third party service providers used by the app [Google Play Services](https://www.google.com/policies/privacy/)

Log Data

We want to inform you that whenever you use our Service, in a case of an error in the app we collect data and information (through third party products) on your phone called Log Data. This Log Data may include information such as your device Internet Protocol (“IP”) address, device name, operating system version, the configuration of the app when utilizing our Service, the time and date of your use of the Service, and other statistics.

Cookies

Cookies are files with a small amount of data that are commonly used as anonymous unique identifiers. These are sent to your browser from the websites that you visit and are stored on your device's internal memory. This Service does not use these “cookies” explicitly. However, the app may use third party code and libraries that use “cookies” to collect information and improve their services. You have the option to either accept or refuse these cookies and know when a cookie is being sent to your device. If you choose to refuse our cookies, you may not be able to use some portions of this Service.

Service Providers

We may employ third-party companies and individuals due to the following reasons: * To facilitate our Service; * To provide the Service on our behalf; * To perform Service-related services; or * To assist us in analyzing how our Service is used. We want to inform users of this Service that these third parties have access to your Personal Information. The reason is to perform the tasks assigned to them on our behalf. However, they are obligated not to disclose or use the information for any other purpose.

Security

We value your trust in providing us your Personal Information, thus we are striving to use commercially acceptable means of protecting it. But remember that no method of transmission over the internet, or method of electronic storage is 100% secure and reliable, and we cannot guarantee its absolute security.

Links to Other Sites

This Service may contain links to other sites. If you click on a third-party link, you will be directed to that site. Note that these external sites are not operated by us. Therefore, we strongly advise you to review the Privacy Policy of these websites. We have no control over and assume no responsibility for the content, privacy policies, or practices of any third-party sites or services.

Children’s Privacy

These Services do not address anyone under the age of 13. We do not knowingly collect personally identifiable information from children under 13\. In the case we discover that a child under 13 has provided us with personal information, we immediately delete this from our servers. If you are a parent or guardian and you are aware that your child has provided us with personal information, please contact us so that we will be able to do necessary actions.

Changes to This Privacy Policy

We may update our Privacy Policy from time to time. Thus, you are advised to review this page periodically for any changes. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page. This policy is effective as of 2020-07-05

Contact Us

If you have any questions or suggestions about our Privacy Policy, do not hesitate to contact us at info@cycleplanet.org. faq.section1:
Profile
How do I edit my profile?
Go to your profile page and select "edit profile". You can visit your profile page by clicking the profile picture in the top-right corner of your screen. On your page, you find a button below your profile picture "Edit profile". In the screen that pops up, you can edit your profile information. Don't forget to hit the save button.

How can I delete my profile?
Go to your profile page and select "edit profile". In the dialog that appears, there is a button called "delete account". This action can not be undone.

Map
How to add a marker?
In the home screen you see a map with all markers. Click the button "+ add marker", and a dialog appears. Select the type of marker you want to add and fill in all the neccessary information.

How can I place myself on the map?
At the home screen, there is a button at the bottom left corner of the map, with an arrow icon that says "add my location". When you press this button, you will be asked to allow your device to get access to your current location. When you accept this, the device will register your location and add a marker to the map. Based on your settings in the "edit profile -> host -> status", the marker will be a different icon.

How can I change my own marker?
Go to "edit profile -> host -> status" and select what applies to your current situation.

0c319dfe-bc85-458c-a425-b9a85f6040c2.description: In 6 months time I cycled from The Netherlands to Cote d'Ivoire as part of my trip around the world. During this trip I went through West Africa, one of the most challenging parts of the world. The love from the local people is what kept me going.
0c319dfe-bc85-458c-a425-b9a85f6040c2.title: The Journey To West Africa

667d5c9a-4409-49af-a001-af5fac4c93b9.description: This route goes from Sierra Leone to Cote d'Ivoire. The first part is paved but in bad condition, untill the capital Monrovia. After 1 or 2 days behind Monrovia, a badly corrugated mud track starts, which becomes even worse once you're getting closer to Greenville. I had to leave the jungle by car because my feet got a fungus infection due to the rain season. I can't recommend to take the road I took, but the alternative road through the North is not much better from what I've seen. But if you like real adventure, you can always try ofcourse.
667d5c9a-4409-49af-a001-af5fac4c93b9.title: From Sierra Leone to Cote d'Ivoire

9ea49d48-d27a-4d7d-9576-155609c3db26.description: I entered Angola in the enclave Cabinda from Congo Republic. From here, I took a small airplane to Soyo and let my bike ship by boat. From Soyo I cycled to Luanda, Lubango and eventually to Namibia.
9ea49d48-d27a-4d7d-9576-155609c3db26.title: From Congo, Republic to Namibia (fly over DRC)

b096d46a-1c45-46e2-a1e7-8a7c742a9d4f.description: This route goes from Diama at the border of Mauritania, to the beautiful Saint-Louis. Then it continues towards The Gambia, and skips Dakar. After The Gambia, the route continues to the border of Guinea-Bissau.

cffaf2bc-da44-4407-895c-be2fcd2e85f1.description: I entered Congo from Gabon, went to Pointe-Noire and from here on I went to Angola's enclave called Cabinda.
cffaf2bc-da44-4407-895c-be2fcd2e85f1.title: Fom Gabon to Angola

d090f48d-0600-438a-89a6-f3e5efba7466.description: This route goed from Liberia to the capital Abidjan, en then goes North to a border crossing with Ghana halfway the country. The roads are in decent condition.
d090f48d-0600-438a-89a6-f3e5efba7466.title: From Liberia to Ghana

e624d8b5-088e-46d8-bc96-7c693e6bc671.description: From the border of Guinea to Freetown, and towards Liberia. Some roads are quite new and good (2019). After Freetown, after a day's ride, this route enters a jungle track which I found really enjoying. It seemed there was a former railway track, which caused the mudroad to be quite straight and going through some quiet and peaceful landscapes.
e624d8b5-088e-46d8-bc96-7c693e6bc671.title: From Guinea to Liberia

e659ec1a-9df7-4c64-9b3f-a5d9ccb4bc44.description: I flew to Libreville, from where I cycled towards Congo, Republic. The route was quite easy and closest to the coast. The last stretch to Congo was unpaved and in bad condition.
e659ec1a-9df7-4c64-9b3f-a5d9ccb4bc44.title: Libreville to Congo, Republic

e768af43-d4fd-4d59-8e59-156b0caec5a1.description: I entered in the North coming from Togo, cycled all the way down to the capital, and went back to Togo on the coast line because the visa for Nigeria was too difficult to get.
e768af43-d4fd-4d59-8e59-156b0caec5a1.title: From North to South

f3c7a053-3886-4e8e-a22d-556387470c04.description: This route goes from Senegal to Guinea, staying as close as possible to the coast line, and goes to the capital Bissau.
f3c7a053-3886-4e8e-a22d-556387470c04.title: From Senegal to Guinea
